title: How to Make Cinnamon Raisin Pinwheel Biscuits

steps.headline: Add milk and stir until a soft dough forms.
Pat or roll out 1/4-inch (.64 cm) thick on a lightly floured surface.
Spread softened butter onto rolled out biscuit dough.
Mix together sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over buttered biscuit dough.
Sprinkle chopped raisins over cinnamon sugar mixture.
Roll up dough, jelly roll style, starting on the long side.
Place sliced dough just barely touching on a shallow baking sheet.
Bake at 425 to 450 °F (218 to 232 °C) (220 to 230 C) until golden, about 20 minutes.

text: Biscuit Dough Combine dry ingredients.  Cut in shortening.  Add milk and stir until a soft dough forms.  Knead dough 8 to 10 times.  Pat or roll out 1/4-inch (.64 cm) thick on a lightly floured surface.  Filling Spread softened butter onto rolled out biscuit dough.  Mix together sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over buttered biscuit dough.  Chop raisins.  Sprinkle chopped raisins over cinnamon sugar mixture.  Roll up dough, jelly roll style, starting on the long side.  Pinch seams together.  Slice dough into 1-inch (2.54 cm) pieces.  Place sliced dough just barely touching on a shallow baking sheet.  Place on baking sheet.  Bake at 425 to 450 °F (218 to 232 °C) (220 to 230 C) until golden, about 20 minutes.  Serves 6.
